notes.title: Ideology of Pakistan & Two-Nation Theory (Evolution & Critiques)
notes.content: Trace pre-partition currents from reformist movements (Sir Syed, Shah Waliullah) to Lahore Resolution; link ideology to constitutional Objectives Resolution and contemporary debates.
keyTakeaways: Understand ideological milestones and their constitutional imprint.
Use primary texts and resolutions to anchor arguments.
Balance historical narrative with contemporary relevance.

notes.title: Constitutional Evolution: 1973 Constitution to 18th Amendment & After
notes.content: Map major amendments (esp. 18th) and their impact on parliamentary supremacy, provincial autonomy, CCI, NFC; connect to recurring exam questions on federal structure.
keyTakeaways: 18th Amendment deepened devolution and strengthened parliamentary system.
CCI is central for inter-governmental coordination.
Know Articles 153–160 (CCI/NFC) and 175A (judiciary).

resources.title: World Bank—Making Federalism Work (18th Amendment analysis)

notes.title: Council of Common Interests (CCI): Role & Performance
notes.content: Explain CCI's constitutional basis, rules of procedure, and agenda areas (energy, water, census, inter-provincial matters). Use recent meetings for examples.
keyTakeaways: CCI ensures cooperative federalism on shared subjects.
Post-18th, meeting frequency and scope expanded.
Census approval and energy policy are recurring CCI issues.

notes.title: National Finance Commission (NFC) Awards—Focus on 7th NFC (2009/10)
notes.content: Explain vertical & horizontal distribution formula; criteria beyond population; fiscal implications for provinces; typical exam comparisons (pre/post-7th NFC).
keyTakeaways: 7th NFC increased provincial share to 57.5% (yrs 2–5).
Horizontal shares added poverty, inverse density, revenue.
Interplay with devolution and provincial service delivery.

notes.title: Elections & Electoral Administration
notes.content: Structure of ECP, election frameworks, recent GE-2024 references (forms, returns, annual report) for data-backed answers on processes and reforms.
keyTakeaways: Use ECP primary documents (forms/reports) for accurate description.
Relate census delimitations & electoral rolls to representation.
Discuss transparency tools and post-election reviews.

notes.title: Demography & Census (PBS 2023 Digital Census)
notes.content: Use PBS 2023 final and detailed results to discuss population distribution, urbanization, literacy, density—tie into policy (representation, service delivery).
keyTakeaways: Quote official PBS final/detailed tables for numeric accuracy.
Connect province-wise trends to fiscal and planning decisions.
Use district tables for case-study style answers.

notes.title: Macroeconomy: Current Snapshot & Trends (Use Latest PES & SBP)
notes.content: Build data-driven narratives on growth, inflation, monetary policy, external accounts; cite latest Economic Survey and SBP Annual Report/Statistical Supplement.
keyTakeaways: Always date-stamp statistics in answers.
Cross-check PES chapter data with SBP annual/SS.
Relate macro stabilization to IMF/WB/ADB support and reforms.

notes.title: Budget & Public Finance (FY2025–26): Priorities, Taxes & Deficit
notes.content: Summarize budget priorities, revenue measures, fiscal deficit targets; use Finance Division's 'Budget in Brief' plus FBR Year Book for tax performance.
keyTakeaways: Quote Budget-in-Brief for aggregates and policy statements.
Use FBR Year Book for revenue composition & compliance.
Link NFC & devolution to social sector spending space.

notes.title: IMF, World Bank & ADB: Programs and Reforms
notes.content: Outline current IMF EFF/RSF reviews and reform conditions; connect WB CPF (10-year lending plan) and ADB CPS priorities to structural reforms and public investment.
keyTakeaways: Explain why macro stabilization + structural reforms go together.
Use official IMF/WB press and review docs for up-to-date facts.
Discuss climate-linked financing (RSF) and social protection.

notes.title: Energy Sector: Generation Mix, Circular Debt & Reforms
notes.content: Use NEPRA State of Industry Report to discuss capacity, dispatch, distribution losses, and reform pathways (tariffing, governance, renewables).
keyTakeaways: Cite NEPRA SIR for authoritative numbers and bottlenecks.
Link energy reforms to fiscal pressures and competitiveness.
Discuss renewable targets vis-à-vis grid constraints.

notes.title: Water Governance: IRSA, Water Apportionment Accord, Dams
notes.content: Explain IRSA's mandate, inter-provincial allocations, and major hydropower/storage projects (Tarbela, Mangla, Dasu, Mohmand, Diamer-Bhasha).
keyTakeaways: Quote IRSA Act and WAA 1991 for legal basis.
Use WAPDA pages for up-to-date project status.
Link water storage to food, energy, and climate resilience.

notes.title: CPEC: Transport, Energy & Industrial Cooperation
notes.content: Summarize CPEC phases, flagship transport/energy projects, and Gwadar's role; discuss Phase-II tilt to SEZs, agriculture, and industrial cooperation.
keyTakeaways: Use official CPEC portal project lists for authoritative references.
Relate connectivity to regional trade and logistics.
Discuss security and sustainability dimensions.

notes.title: Gwadar Port & Balochistan: Geostrategy & Development
notes.content: Use GPA official site for port functions; connect Gwadar to logistics chains, fisheries, energy imports; discuss local development concerns.
keyTakeaways: Gwadar's strategic location complements overland corridors.
Local benefits depend on integration with provincial economy.
Security, water, and power reliability are enabling factors.

notes.title: Kashmir Issue: UNMOGIP & UNSC Framework
notes.content: Outline UN involvement (UNMOGIP) and early UNSC resolutions; show how ceasefire/plebiscite frameworks shaped subsequent bilateral agreements.
keyTakeaways: Quote UN mission facts (location, HQ, mandate history).
UNSC early resolutions provide historical legal context.
Relate to Simla Agreement and bilateralism debates.

notes.title: SCO & Pakistan's Regional Diplomacy
notes.content: Explain Pakistan's SCO membership context; economic, security, and connectivity cooperation areas; cite SCO secretariat for institutional overview.
keyTakeaways: SCO complements Pakistan's continental connectivity agenda.
Agenda spans security, economics, culture.
Use current summit communiqués for examples.

notes.title: Foreign Policy: Multilateral Engagements & Economic Diplomacy
notes.content: Use IMF/WB/ADB/UN sources to demonstrate how economic stabilization ties to diplomacy; include climate finance pivot (RSF).
keyTakeaways: Economic diplomacy is central (IMF, WB CPF, ADB CPS).
Climate-linked finance increasingly shapes policy choices.
Back claims with official communiqués and reviews.

notes.title: Agriculture & Food Security
notes.content: Summarize agriculture's share, crops, productivity constraints; tie to water governance, climate, and MNFSR policy documents.
keyTakeaways: Productivity hinges on water management & inputs.
Climate resilience and value chains are key themes.
Use PES agriculture chapter + MNFSR strategic docs.

resources.title: National Pathways for Food Systems Transformation (MNFSR)

notes.title: Human Development: Poverty, HDI & Social Protection
notes.content: Use UNDP/UN Pakistan updates for HDI and MPI; link to poverty trends and social protection reforms; cross-reference WB diagnostics.
keyTakeaways: Always contextualize indicators with methodology and year.
Discuss inequalities and regional disparities.
Cite social protection programs under fiscal constraints.

notes.title: Climate Change: Policy, NDCs & Loss-Damage Discourse
notes.content: Summarize Pakistan's climate policy architecture (NCCP 2012; updates), NDC 2021 and NDC 3.0 (2025 draft), and adaptation/mitigation priorities.
keyTakeaways: Use official MoCC/NDC documents for targets and sectors.
Connect climate finance to development planning.
Discuss vulnerability (floods) and resilience measures.

notes.title: Disaster Management & Resilience
notes.content: Situate climate disasters within governance and budgeting; reference budget allocations and institutional frameworks (NDMA/provincial DMAs).
keyTakeaways: Budgetary signals show prioritization of resilience.
Coordination across federal–provincial tiers is crucial.
Use recent floods as case studies for lessons learned.

notes.title: Manufacturing, Industry & SMEs
notes.content: Use PES manufacturing/mining chapter and SBP sector scans; relate energy pricing, exchange rate stability, and credit conditions to industrial output.
keyTakeaways: Energy costs and access to finance critically shape output.
Exchange rate and inflation stabilization lower uncertainty.
SEZs and logistics (CPEC) can spur clustering.

notes.title: Money & Credit: Monetary Policy and Financial Sector
notes.content: Explain monetary policy transmission, inflation targeting band, and financial inclusion; use SBP reports for credible references.
keyTakeaways: Policy rate decisions reflect inflation outlook & external risks.
Financial sector health ties to growth and stability.
Cite SBP Governor's Annual Report & MPS excerpts where relevant.

notes.title: Trade, Balance of Payments & External Sector
notes.content: Present a structured view of exports, imports, remittances, and current account; cite SBP/PBS and WB data portals; relate to competitiveness and diversification.
keyTakeaways: Use balance of payments tables and trade stats precisely.
Remittances and services exports are key cushions.
Diversification and productivity are recurring prescriptions.

notes.title: Public Administration & Bureaucracy: Reform Debates
notes.content: Anchor answers in constitutional provisions, devolution context, and service delivery outcomes post-18th; draw on CCI/IPC and PES governance notes.
keyTakeaways: Devolution changed center–province roles.
Intergovernmental coordination is critical for outcomes.
Evidence-based reforms link to fiscal and HR capacity.

notes.title: Regional Connectivity: CPEC Logistics, SEZs & Trade Corridors
notes.content: Go beyond project lists—explain corridor logic, border nodes, inland dry ports, and how SEZs can integrate with export strategies.
keyTakeaways: Corridor effects depend on soft infrastructure and reforms.
SEZ success: utilities, skills, logistics, and policy certainty.
Tie to SCO/regional markets for exam's comparative angles.

notes.title: Exam Skills: Comparative, Critical & MCQ Readiness
notes.content: Build source-backed outlines, comparison matrices (e.g., Nehru Report vs. Fourteen Points; Simla Agreement vs. UNSC 47), and MCQ fact-sheets.
keyTakeaways: Always cite a primary source or top-tier institutional report.
Date-stamp every statistic; avoid generic claims.
Practice with latest FPSC papers and structure answers to rubric.
